title: Twitter reacts to Yair Rodriguez's win over Jeremy Stephens in UFC on ESPN 6 barnburner
text:
Yair Rodriguez got the last laugh over Jeremy Stephens on Friday when he emerged victorious from their grudge match at UFC on ESPN 6.

After the initial meeting ended in a quick no contest due to an eye poke, Rodriguez (12-2 MMA, 8-1 UFC) proved superior to Stephens (28-17 MMA, 15-16 UFC) when they actually got to fight with a unanimous decision win in the featherweight bout, which took place at TD Garden in Boston and aired on ESPN2.

Check below for the top Twitter reactions to Rodriguez’s victory over Stephens at UFC on ESPN 6.

* * * *

The featherweight grudge match is about to go down: Jeremy Stephens (@LiLHeathenMMA) and Yair Rodriguez (@panteraufc) are about to run it back in the #UFCBoston co-main event. https://t.co/44OWf0fomk pic.twitter.com/Emp0sJford — MMA Junkie (@MMAjunkie) October 19, 2019

I mean yeah you GOTTA start it with a flying side kick to the face — caposa (@Grabaka_Hitman) October 19, 2019

Finally — michael (@bisping) October 19, 2019

Rodriguez fights like someone is controlling him with a Playstation controller. #UFCBoston — Rob Tatum (@RobTatum303) October 19, 2019

I thought that the three round fight would allow Stephens to go for broke and throw caution to the wind. The exact opposite has played out and Rodriguez is throwing a diverse arsenal at Stephens. 10-9 Rodriguez. — Aaron Bronsteter (@aaronbronsteter) October 19, 2019

Heathen is drilled to the body n he wilts. Yair jumps on his and unloads a storm of punches #UFCBoston — Sherdog by Mandatory (@sherdogdotcom) October 19, 2019

If nothing else, Jeremy Stephens is one tough cookie. — Andreas Hale (@AndreasHale) October 19, 2019

Great job again by Kevin MacDonald there. #UFCBoston — Seán Sheehan (@SeanSheehanBA) October 19, 2019

This ref is def pro Stephens — Belal Muhammad (@bullyb170) October 19, 2019

HOLY SHIT Stephens is back on his feet! Zombie man! #UFCBoston — Tommy Toe Hold (@TommyToeHold) October 19, 2019

Smart of Yair to work the body and am surprised Stephens is still in this fight… — Dan Tom (@DanTomMMA) October 19, 2019

DO WE ALL AGREE NOW? Jeremy Stephens sure as hell wasnt looking for a way out in Mexico City. Unreal toughness in Round 2. #UFCBoston — Simon Samano (@SJSamano) October 19, 2019

How do could you not love @LiLHeathenMMA #UFCBoston — Frank Mir (@thefrankmir) October 19, 2019

Jeremy ain’t no bitch!! RD 3!!! This fight is crazy!! #UFCBoston — Aljamain Sterling (@funkmasterMMA) October 19, 2019

10-8 round for Yair. 20-17. — Brandon Gibson (@SixGunGibson) October 19, 2019

Man @LiLHeathenMMA it’s a monster so much heart ✊🏾 #UFCBoston — GILBERT BURNS DURINHO (@GilbertDurinho) October 19, 2019

I wish this fight was 5 rounds 🔥 #UFCBoston — Katlyn Chookagian (@blondefighter) October 19, 2019

What a round!!!! @LiLHeathenMMA is a G and is never out of the fight! #UFCBoston — Chris Camozzi (@ChrisCamozzi) October 19, 2019

Stephens survive😱 crazy fight 🍿 #UFCBoston — Yana Kunitskaya (@YanaKunitskaya1) October 19, 2019

Give these dudes an inhaler. #UFCBoston — Punch Kick Chill (@PunchKickChill) October 19, 2019

I think Yair had enough offense to avoid the 10-8 in R3. 29-28 Yair. What a fucking fight. Well worth the wait. — caposa (@Grabaka_Hitman) October 19, 2019

Gosh damn it! I demand two more rounds! #UFCBoston — Tatiana Suarez (@tatianaufc) October 19, 2019

Damn good fight, @LiLHeathenMMA is tough as hell @ufc fight of the night!!! — kurt holobaugh (@KurtHolobaugh) October 19, 2019

That’s the fight we all wanted! Great fight @LiLHeathenMMA @panteraufc . Congrats to both of you and I wouldn’t mind seeing it again regardless of the outcome!#UFCBoston — Chris Camozzi (@ChrisCamozzi) October 19, 2019

Well that fight woke me right up !! #UFCBoston #fotn !!! — JIMI MANUWA (@POSTERBOYJM) October 19, 2019

Damn that was a good fight. I completely forgot that wasnt the main event #UFCBoston — Sodiq Yusuff (@Super_Sodiq) October 19, 2019
description: See the top Twitter reactions to Yair Rodriguez's win over Jeremy Stephens in their grudge match at UFC on ESPN 6.
